question: In which nation "Golfo Dulce" is located?
explanation: Golfo Dulce is a tropical gulf facing the Pacific Ocean which separates the Osa Peninsula from the mainland Costa Rica. Piedras Blancas National Park lies to the north of this gulf. Golfo Dulce is one of the only four tropical fjords on the planet. In fact, it is the only place on the globe where populations of both Northern and Southern Humpback Whales meet to birth their young ones, it hosts "Mission Blue Hope Spot" for the conservation of the same.
